description: Inflected form of conjugate. Sense 2 is  a semantic loan from German Konjugation, konjugieren, coined 1899 by German chemist Johannes Thiele.

adjectives.description: conjugated (comparative more conjugated, superlative most conjugated)

entries.meaning: (organic chemistry, of an organic compound or part of such a compound) Containing one or more pairs of double bonds and/or lone pairs, each pair being separated by a single bond.
examples: A major interest in the study of conjugated polymers in solution is the opportunity to investigate the relation between electronic properties and conformational disorder in low dimensional materials.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of conjugate
